Zapnite Thunderbird a budete vyzvaný zadať prihlasovacie údaje - zadajte správne prihlasovacie údaje.

content:
Ansam said
Je to preto, že pre ten problematický emailový účet máte uložených viac prihlasovacích údajov.

Ano máte pravdu. Vyřešeno. Po smazání hesel jsem opět obdržel výzvu k zadání nového hesla, tak jak jsem byl zvyklí dříve. Ale popravdě vůbec nechápu jak při současném systému mohu mít pro jeden účet uloženo více hesel. Jak se tam ty jiný hesla vůbec dostali ?

Ale teď mi nastal další problém. Na portálu jsem si změnil heslo, se kterým se normálně přihlašuju na portálu pomocí webového rozhraní. Pro daný účet jsem tedy logicky změnil heslo i v thunderbirdu. K mému překvapení ale to nové heslo v thunderbirdu nefunguje. Takže jsem to nové heslo musel v thunderbirtu opět nahradit tím starým původním abych se pomocí thundebirdu přihlásil a stáhl emaily. Jenom dodávám že se jedná o email na portálu @centrum.cz. Takže pro přístup na @centrum.cz musím momentálně mít 2 hesla. Jedno pro webový přístup, druhé staré pro thunderbird.

Ví někdo proč se to děje a jak to opravit?

content:
oldarez napsal(a)
'Ale teď mi nastal další problém. Na portálu jsem si změnil heslo, se kterým se normálně přihlašuju na portálu pomocí webového rozhraní. Pro daný účet jsem tedy logicky změnil heslo i v thunderbirdu. K mému překvapení ale to nové heslo v thunderbirdu nefunguje. ....

Zopakujte ten istý proces odznova aj u tohoto účtu: Aj pre tento problematický emailový účet máte uložených viac prihlasovacích údajov. Otvorte si "Uložené heslá" a pre daný účet odstráňte všetky uložené heslá (aj tie správne aj tie nesprávne). Vypnite Thunderbird. Zapnite Thunderbird a budete vyzvaný zadať prihlasovacie údaje - zadajte správne prihlasovacie údaje.

content:
First, I am only a volunteer, but I would be surprised to see the equivalent of Format Painter added. But, Thunderbird is very flexible, allowing for strong HTML support or plain text support. In a prior post, I summarized the steps. Here is link to that post: 

 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1462509

If you do extensive cutting and pasting for HTML messages, it can get messy regardless of the email client used. that is because HTML is just a markup language. If you encounter that a lot, I suggest installing this addon, ThunderHTMLedit, from https://www.betterbird.eu/addons/ no other HTML editor comes close.

david

content:
Problem: Thunderbird synchronisiert einige E-Mailkonten nicht mehr.

Folgende Maßnahmen durchgeführt: 1. Weitere Sicherung: unter Profilordner Appdata / Roaming/ thunderbird, den Ordner in Thunderbird_alt umbenannt, 2. Thunderbird deinstalliert danach aktuelle Version heruntergeladen und neu installiert 3. Somit wurde ein neuer Profilordner erstellt, 4. Nun wollte ich aus dem Profilordner unter Appdata / Roaming/ thunderbird_alt die lokalen Ordner kopieren und in den neuen Profilordner einfügen. Leider waren nun alle Profile nicht mehr da? Das hatte ich bisher nicht! Diese wurden auch nicht gelöscht. Der Papierkorb ist leer. Ebenso wurden durch MacriumReflect die Profilordner von Thunderbird auch nicht vorher gesichert? Nun sind alle lokalen E-Mails weg? Wie kann das sein? Wie bekomme ich diese wieder? Gerne höre ich von Ihnen

Problem: Thunderbird is no longer synchronizing some email accounts.

I've taken the following steps:

1. I made another backup: I renamed the profile folder to Thunderbird_old in the AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird profile folder.

2. I uninstalled Thunderbird, then downloaded and reinstalled the latest version.

3. This created a new profile folder.

4. I then tried to copy the local folders from the profile folder in AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird_old and paste them into the new profile folder. Unfortunately, all the profiles are now gone! This has never happened before! They weren't deleted, and the trash is empty.

Also, Macrium Reflect didn't back up the Thunderbird profile folders beforehand.

Now all my local emails are gone?

How is this possible? How can I get them back?

I look forward to hearing from you.


Systemordner Thunderbird umbenannt und neues Profil erstellt, alle E-Mail Konten neu integriert, Teste i.O.,

Aus alten Thunderbird Ordner war plötzlich keine Profilordner mehr vorhanden? Wieso plötzlich das? Sicherungen hatten leider auch keinen Profilordner von Thunderbird gesichert. Warum werden diese nicht gesichert?
creator: Dirk.Parchmann

content:
Which was the reason for renaming your Thunderbird folder in Thunderbird-old and create a new Thunderbird installation? The simplest way to copy/paste your Local Folders from the old Thunderbird profile would have been to go ...\Mail\Local Folders\ in the old profile folder, copy the Local Folders folder and past it in the same registry \Mail\ in the newly created profile folder xxxxxxxx.default-release (or whatever it's his name).

When you write "local folders" do you mean local folders in general such as Inbox, Sent, ...in a POP account or do you mean the "special account" Local Folders which is generally displayed below the other account folders in the folder pane on the left ?

citation " I then tried to copy the local folders from the profile folder in AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird_old and paste them into the new profile folder. Unfortunately, all the profiles are now gone! This has never happened before! They weren't deleted, and the trash is empty." ....... and... "Problem: Thunderbird is no longer synchronizing some email accounts". Your problems are still very difficult to understand! Aren't you confusing profiles and accounts?

Which server type did you use for your email accounts, IMAP or POP? Which is your OS? Which is your actual version of Thunderbird?

Please show screen shots of • the contents of the folder "Profiles" in Thunderbird folder in your new installation • idem for the contents of the file "profiles.ini" in the Thunderbird folder The same screen shots with contents of "Profiles" and "profiles.ini "in Thunderbird-old

content:
Have you tries removing any oauth entries in the password manager for google SMTP servers. It sounds like Thunderbird thinks it has a valid token.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb

Check the identity for the account (the entry above server settings in account settings) that the correct SMTP server is selected and that there is only one identity on the account (if there are more identities each needs to be checked as the SMTP is identity specific.)

Check what SMTP server is set as "default". Many actions in Thunderbird will use the default, including many folder contexts outside of the all folders view, so you might be using the default not the on for the identity.

content:
the IP address is he address of the device on the internet. It is allocated by your service provider when you access the internet. Your phone has one as does your desktop and any other device connected to the internet.

Based on what you have posted, it sounds like Comcast have blacklisted your computer for some reason. Perhaps ask them why. My guess is you started out using the VPN and comcast did not like that and blocked you and now you are blocked so nothing you do will fix it until the block times out, however long that is set to be (the use of the word temporarily indicates it will timeout some time.) or Comcast life the block. I would recommend the later as I am only guessing as to the cause. It might be you tried to log in three times with the wrong password and the password is saved on your system or it could by any of a million and one other reasons. Only Comcast knows at this point in time.

content:
Pretend we have no idea who force9 or Greenby are and you will be getting close to where I am now.

I am guessing that they are either an ISP or hosting provider, or at least one of them is.

Google pointed me to this question and answer page https://greenby.com/faq so I know a little more, but seriously you are going to have to offer much more in the way of information is anyone is going to offer constructive assistance.

My first reaction is when was your account migrated? My second was what is the error you receive? My third was have you a third party antivirus? As they are notorious for messing up email connections disabling them is often the first diagnostic task. ( on Windows defender kicks in as soon as the third party product gets out of the way so you are not left hanging out there with no protection.

I did try looking at the plus net community for information but they have blocked anyone not in the UK accessing their website (or certainly from Australia, we must be a threat to their business somehow I guess). So their support site is only available to you not me.

https://community.plus.net/t5/Email/Force9-migration-to-Greenby/td-p/2027804

creator: 62063e

content:
Ok, so it appears this is may be a problem handling Sectigo's S/MIME certificate generation. It appears that if downloaded too quickly, Sectigo's initial file does not actually contain the key (checking with openssl x509). Downloading again, it did contain the key, though loading it required restarting Thunderbird before it eventually showed up.

Showing orphan private keys in the certificate manager (eg, the ones that show up with certutil -K) might make this process less stressful.

content:
This sounds like an issue for your sys admin.

Thunderbird never has it's junk setting disabled unless the system administrator sets it up that way. I have not had any reason to investigate how these corporate settings are used or managed for more than 10 years. But on windows policies are the control measure of choice I understand.

BTW Thunderbird does not create any folders for an IMAP account when the account is first setup, they are created based on offerings from the server. As it synchronizes those offered by the server, it may well be that someone has disabled the setting to offer spam as an IAP folder with Google. I would guess it would be unlikely Thunderbird would subscribe the spam folder if it's spam settings are disabled. There would be nothing to prompt the subscription. Have you tried right clicking the account in the folder pane and selecting subscribe from the offered menu?

Check this link (it is to a free google account, but I think workspaces offers the same thing. https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#settings/labels Gmail only requires the inbox to be offered via IMAP, perhaps your administrator has limited folders offered at google directly.

content:
Hello Matt,

Yes, I did click the link, and I also posted images showing the Gmail label settings for this account. The Spam label is enabled in Gmail, exactly the same as all my other Gmail and Workspace accounts.

I need to emphasize the key point again:

This is the ONLY Gmail/Workspace account in Thunderbird that does NOT show a Spam/Junk folder. All of my other accounts — set up using the exact same steps — show that folder normally.

In addition, this account is also not receiving messages in Thunderbird at all. Messages sent to max@dantanas.com

do not appear in the Inbox, even after repairs, resyncs, or reinstalling the account.

So this is no longer just a Junk folder issue — Thunderbird is failing to synchronize basic IMAP folders for this account only.

This is not caused by:

• Gmail settings • Workspace admin controls • IMAP subscriptions • Server restrictions • A provider-side limitation

The account works normally in Gmail webmail and on other devices. The issue appears only in Thunderbird.

I have already tried:

• Subscribe (Spam is not offered) • Removing and readding the account • Comparing Gmail IMAP label settings with working accounts • Repairing folders • Rebuilding the folder list • Resetting junk settings • Confirming that other Gmail/Workspace accounts receive mail and display Spam correctly

None of these change the outcome: Thunderbird does not display the Spam/Junk folder and does not receive any messages for this account.

What I need is a clear, step-by-step Thunderbird-specific procedure that forces:

Thunderbird to resync all IMAP folders for this account

Thunderbird to recognize and map Gmail’s Spam folder

Thunderbird to restore normal mail reception for this account

If this issue is outside your scope or if someone else has deeper experience with Google Workspace behavior in Thunderbird, please feel free to pass this case to a colleague who may be better positioned to help.

Thank you, Max
creator: max115

content:
Hi Max,

I appreciate your wish for step-by-step instructions to fix the problem, and I expect that people here will do their best to provide them. First, people are trying to understand the cause of this unusual problem.

Matt and sfhowes (who responded to this same question that you posted in a different discussion) know much more than I do. I may be able to help diagnose the problem by trying to be thorough. So  … 

1. Are the incoming server settings for this account the same as your normally functioning gmail accounts (other than user name)? Check settings by going to account settings and clicking on server settings under each account. Server name, port, connection security, authentication method -- all the same? User name is always the full e-mail address?

2. While you are in account settings, click on "Copies & Folders" in the left pane. Enable "Place a copy in:", then select "Other". Click on the drop-down list that is right of the "Other" option. Hold the mouse pointer over the name of the troublesome account. Which folders are listed?

3. Leave account settings and return to the main tab. Right click again on the account name in the folder pane, as you did before, and click on "Subscribe". In the window that appears next, click on "Refresh". Do any folder names appear?

4. What steps did you take to re-add the account? Did you see any error messages or anything unusual in that process?

5. Is there any difference in how your gmail accounts are administered? Are they all at your own domains? If you had to create the MX records, are they correct for this account? Did the page that Matt referred you to have any useful information about administration of these accounts?

6. Do you see any error message when trying to receive messages in this account?
